meanings.definition: Stiffly formal and proper in behavior or dress.
meanings.sent1: She always looks very prim in her fancy dresses.
meanings.sent2: The prim lady at the party refused to dance.
meanings.sent3: The prim librarian shushed the noisy children with a stern look.
meanings.sent4: The prim garden was perfectly manicured and organized.
meanings.sent5: Her prim hairstyle matched her prim personality.

meanings.definition: To purse the lips in a disapproving way.
meanings.sent1: When she heard the gossip, she couldn't help but prim her lips.
meanings.sent2: He would prim his lips whenever someone mentioned his ex-girlfriend.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to prim her lips to stop herself from laughing at the silly mistake.
meanings.sent4: She would prim her lips in disapproval whenever he played loud music.
meanings.sent5: Her grandmother would prim her lips at any sign of bad manners.

meanings.definition: To make oneself look neat and tidy.
meanings.sent1: She would prim herself before going out to meet her friends.
meanings.sent2: He would prim himself in front of the mirror before a job interview.
meanings.sent3: The cat would prim itself after every meal, licking its fur meticulously.
meanings.sent4: The actor would prim himself before stepping onto the red carpet.
meanings.sent5: The bird would prim its feathers before flying off into the sky.
